critique: The document is an executive order that appoints Mrs. Laura Mae Decker to a position in the Department of Agriculture without regard to civil service rules. This appears to be a special consideration based on her late husband's long service in the government. It is recommended by the Secretary of Agriculture. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power implications, federalism concerns, national security vs. civil liberties issues, economic regulation aspects, or social inclusion considerations. The order seems to be a specific, individual case.
